channel.title: I think I'm unable to host, help please?
channel.description:
Okay, so I've made numerous servers in the past but it was years ago. I'm tryin to make one now, but I think I'm either leaving out a step, or my router just can't host.
[b]Cmd > IPconfig:[/b]
http://prntscr.com/rqwvx
[b]Logged in my router > Advanced > Advanced Setup > PortForwarding / Port Triggering:[/b]
http://prntscr.com/rqx7m
[b]And then to check to see if the port was enabled, I went to canyouseeme.org and checked port 43594:[/b]
http://prntscr.com/rqx3n
How can I fix this connection timed out issue? I don't really remember. But even when I'm just trying to code offline, my client won't let me connect to my local host "127.0.0.1" . Please help, willing to pay on the diffaculty.

item.title: I think I'm unable to host, help please?
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

acat2798:

Were you running the server when you checked to see if the ports were open? If not run the server then check to see if the ports are open

Lol that wont help at all>_>… Even tho was curious and did test… Not surprised since it came from first time poster.

Read full topic

item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

(Can’t ask anyone help since I’m from Finland, and that’s why my computer is as Finnish language)

item.title: I think I'm unable to host, help please?
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Portforwarding allows connections to be made to the specific IP that you set the port to. If you’re just going to be on it, there is no need to portforward.

Read full topic
item.source: I think I'm unable to host, help please?

item.title: I think I'm unable to host, help please?
item.dc:creator: @xI_c_E xI c E
item.description:
@xI_c_E wrote:

If you can’t connect via localhost then it’s something on your computer that’s not allowing connections such as anti virus software.

Read full topic
item.source: I think I'm unable to host, help please?

item.title: I think I'm unable to host, help please?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“Nicksworld, post:8, topic:481723”]server ip name in your rater needs to be 192.168.1.1
…[/quote]
That’s the default gateway… you need to port forward it to a specific ip address within the router
